intro: Zappania canescens, commonly known as the hairy zappania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. Zappania canescens thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ability to store water in its leaves make it a notable species in xerophytic ecosystems.
